intro: Chusua monophylla, commonly known as the single-leaf chusua, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its single, large, heart-shaped leaf. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often growing in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
